p: N. jatamansi and N. chinensis were mainly distributed in subalpine to alpine areas, where the elevation is more than 3,000 m. The Qinghai–Tibetan Plateau is the main distribution area, ranging from 25° to 40°N, 74° to 104°E. The Qinghai–Tibetan Plateau is the world’s highest plateau, with an altitude of between 3,000 and 5,000 m and an average elevation of over 3,500 m. The climate of the Qinghai–Tibetan Plateau is monsoonal. The annual average temperature in most parts of the region is below 8 °C, and the annual precipitation is 400–900 mm/year.
